title: Tenant Deposit Rights (General)
text: Tenants are entitled to receive their security deposit back if there is no damage beyond normal wear and tear. Steps: (1) Request the landlord for deposit refund in writing, (2) Ask for an itemized deduction list if any money is withheld, (3) If not resolved, file a complaint at the local Rent Controller office. Emergency: Police Helpline 100.

title: Consumer Right - Refund for Defective Goods
text: If you receive defective goods, you can: (1) Contact the seller/shop and request replacement or refund, (2) Keep the invoice and proof of purchase safe, (3) If unresolved, file a complaint at the District Consumer Forum, (4) Call the National Consumer Helpline 1800-11-4000 or file online at consumerhelpline.gov.in.

title: Cyber Fraud - Online Banking Scam
text: Online fraud is a punishable offence under the IT Act. Steps: (1) Call National Cybercrime Helpline 1930 immediately, (2) File complaint on cybercrime.gov.in, (3) Lodge FIR at nearest police station or cyber cell, (4) Keep SMS, bank statements, and transaction details as evidence.

title: Delayed Salary - Labour Law
text: Employees must receive wages before 7th or 10th of the next month. Steps: (1) Write complaint to employer in writing/email, (2) If unresolved, file a claim with Labour Commissioner, (3) Approach Labour Court for legal remedy. Helpline: 155214.

title: Minimum Wages Protection
text: Every worker must be paid at least the government-declared minimum wage. Steps: (1) Check state notification for rates, (2) If underpaid, approach Labour Commissioner, (3) Call Labour Helpline 155214 for assistance.

title: Right to Information
text: Any citizen may seek information from government offices. Steps: (1) Draft a simple RTI application (mention name, address, question, Rs. 10 fee), (2) Send to Public Information Officer of department, (3) If no reply within 30 days, appeal to First Appellate Authority. Online portal: rtionline.gov.in.

title: Domestic Violence Protection
source: Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005
text: Victims can get legal and police protection. Steps: (1) Call Women Helpline 181 or Police 100, (2) Approach Protection Officer/District Legal Services Authority, (3) File complaint in Magistrate Court for protection, residence, or monetary relief. Free legal aid available.

title: Dowry Harassment
text: Dowry harassment is a crime. Steps: (1) Call Police Women Helpline 1091, (2) File FIR under Dowry Act and Section 498A IPC, (3) Seek help from District Womenâ€™s Cell or NCW helpline 7827170170.

title: Marriage and Divorce
text: Either spouse may file for divorce. Steps: (1) Collect marriage proof and ID, (2) File petition in Family Court citing grounds (mutual consent, cruelty, desertion etc.), (3) Attend hearings, (4) Court grants decree. Legal Aid Helpline: 1516.

title: Child Labour
text: Child labour under 14 in hazardous work is illegal. Steps: (1) Report case immediately to Childline 1098, (2) Inform District Labour Office, (3) Rescue and rehabilitation arranged by authorities.

title: Workplace Sexual Harassment
text: Sexual harassment at workplace is illegal. Steps: (1) File complaint with Internal Complaints Committee within 3 months, (2) If no ICC, complain to District Officer, (3) Call Women Helpline 181 for immediate support.

title: SC/ST Atrocities Protection
text: Discrimination or violence against SC/ST is a punishable offence. Steps: (1) File FIR immediately at police station, (2) Demand FIR under SC/ST Act sections, (3) Contact SC/ST helpline 1800-1800-214, (4) Free legal aid through District Legal Services Authority.

title: Lok Adalat - Free Dispute Resolution
text: Lok Adalat provides free settlement of disputes like family, property, and cheque bounce cases. Steps: (1) Approach District/State Legal Services Authority, (2) Submit dispute details, (3) Attend Lok Adalat session for compromise, (4) Award is final and binding. Legal Aid Helpline: 1516.

title: Emergency Helplines (India)
text: Police 100 | Ambulance 108 | Fire 101 | Women Helpline 181 | Childline 1098 | Cybercrime 1930 | Consumer 1800-11-4000 | Labour 155214 | Legal Aid 1516 | SC/ST 1800-1800-214.
